First Move: 
The game of Sungka begins in a simultaneous move mode. After the countdown finishes, both players make their first moves as fast as possible. This is because the player that finishes their move first gets to start in the next round. 
Note that choosing your left most cup will grant you an extra move, which means you would have to finish that in addition to exhausting all of your moves. 
Your cups are at the bottom of the screen. Tap on the screen to begin the countdown!
First Move Tutorial End: \nThis is the end of the tutorial, go back to the main menu by pressing the button in the center of the screen.

Extra Moves: \nThis tutorial will explain the mechanics of extra moves. An extra move allows you to perform multiple consecutive actions. An extra move is gained if the last shell of the move is dropped in the players store. \nTap on the left most cup, notice that the last shell distributed ends up in your store. This means that you will get an extra turn.

Extra Moves: 
The two right most cups on your side of the board would both lead to an extra move however the order in which you tap them matters. 
For the purpose of this tutorial, select the second cup from the right. Notice that the right most cup will no longer give you an extra move. 
Both of these cups can give you an extra move if tapped in the proper order.
Extra Moves: \nFollow the next couple of moves and notice how multiple extra moves can be chained one after another.

Extra Moves: \nFinally you may have noticed that massive pile of shells in one of your cups. Tap on this cup, observe what happens and remember the rule of an extra move (if the last shell lands in your store you will get an extra move).

Robbing Rule: \nOne of the rules in the game of Sungka allows the player to steal all shells from the opponentâ€™s cup. This rule says that if the last shell of the move lands in one of your empty cups (except your store!), then the last shell and all the shells from the cup on the opposite side of the board are moved to your store. \nTry this out yourself, select the highlighted cup and see what happens.

Robbing Rule: \nIt is very easy to notice obvious moves that lead to robbing. However, you should be careful as it is very easy to focus too much on these moves and in the process miss negative effects of them. \nTry it one more time. Notice that the same rule applies even when it goes through your opponents cups, as long as it ends in your empty cup.
Robbing Rule: \nWhenever you have 15 shells in one of your cups, tapping on that cup will always result in robbing the opposite cup. Press on your leftmost cup and see what happens.
End of Tutorial: \nThe player with the most amount of shells in the players store wins the game. You can continue playing or you can exit by using the back button.
